name: data terms of use (dtou)
tagline: social contracts for heterogeneous data in decentralised environments
body:
### Introduction
This work focuses on allowing people control how their personal information, (that is, information created _by_ them, _about_ them, _toward_ them, or _for_ them) should be handled in situations where there are many separate data controllers.  

Note that this is not a framework for guaranteeing the enforcement of such preferences; but for supporting the expression of such preferences and allowing people to easily comply with them if they choose (for politeness), or to be able to easily understand the ways that their uses of such information violates actorsâ€™ intents.

### Level 1 : Intentions of Use (Contextual Integrity)

### Level 2 : Social Conventions & Expectations (Heterogeneity)

### Level 3 : Access Control, Handling Accountability
